meanings.definition: To cause someone to believe something that is not true
meanings.sent1: She deceived her friend by telling a fake story.
meanings.sent2: He was deceived by the false promises of the salesman.
meanings.sent3: The magician deceived the audience with his clever tricks.
meanings.sent4: The mirage in the desert deceived the weary travelers.
meanings.sent5: The disguise was so convincing that it deceived everyone at the party.

meanings.definition: To be misled or tricked by someone or something
meanings.sent1: They were deceived by the misleading advertisement.
meanings.sent2: She felt deceived when she found out the truth.
meanings.sent3: The mirror's reflection deceived her into thinking the room was bigger.
meanings.sent4: The calm surface of the water deceived him about the strong currents below.
meanings.sent5: The fake news article deceived many readers into believing a hoax.
